aboutCompany.title: About the Company
body: Information Technology Academy is an interactive education program that provides systematic training to help engineers grow their software development skills. The program focuses on coding, algorithms, data structures, and system design.
Our industry experts teach practical material that focuses on designing and implementing industry products and systems, with an emphasis on programming skills.

subContent.title: Our Mission
subContent.body: To bridge the skills gap between employee supply and employer demand.

subContent.title: Our Vision
subContent.body: To empower each member of the workforce with the skills they need to fulfill their career dreams.

aboutInstructors.title: About the Instructors
body: Our instructors have worked as engineering leaders for various top-tier Silicon Valley companies including Google, Facebook, Hortonworks, Uber, LinkedIn, Box, and Twitter.
Their real-world experiences help students gain and develop the knowledge and skills needed to have a successful software engineering career.

In addition to highly-successful careers, our instructors have been educated at some of the world’s top universities, giving them a strong foundation to both understand and teach challenging technical concepts.

ourStory.title: Our Story
ourStory.body: IT Academy was founded by Rick Sun and Jing Zhao, two Computer Science Ph.D. graduates from the University of Southern California. While working for prestigious Silicon Valley companies, they realized there was a gap between the hiring needs that employers have and the skill sets that candidates have. They came up with an idea and a plan to help eliminate this gap, and IT Academy was started.

teamMember1.name: Rick Sun
teamMember1.title: Co-Founder
teamMember1.detail: Rick received his Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Southern California, where he was recognized for developing novel, high-performance search-based algorithms. He then went on to work at Google, where he worked on several projects during his time there. His technical expertise includes cross-platform proficiency as well as fluency in a number of programming languages.

teamMember1.name: Jing Zhao
teamMember1.title: Co-Founder
teamMember1.detail: Jing graduated from Tsinghua University with B.S. and M.S. in Computer Science, and then went on to get his Ph.D. from the University of Southern California, also in Computer Science. After completing his Ph.D. he has been an active Apache Hadoop contributor, committer, and PMC member.

teamMember1.name: Ed Campana
teamMember1.title: Instructor
teamMember1.detail: Ed has worked in the recruiting department at several top-tier technology companies, including Amazon, LinkedIn, and Pure Storage. He has supported engineering teams both domestically and internationally, and and has helped hire hundreds of engineers in his career.

teamMember2.name: Li Zhang
teamMember2.title: Instructor
teamMember2.detail: Li received his Bachelor’s Degree from Tsinghua University before attending the University of Southern California for his Master’s Degree (both in Computer Science). His research studies include computer vision, including automatic facial feature point extraction (face alignment). In college he was the coach of the Chinese International Olympiad in Informatics (IOI) and has worked for Google, Facebook, and Airbnb.

teamMember2.name: Jiong Wang
teamMember2.title: Instructor
teamMember2.detail: Jiong holds three degrees, including a Master’s Degree in Computer Science from Stanford University. He has led engineering teams at some of the top, high-growth companies in the Bay Area, including LinkedIn and Twitter. He is well-versed in system design, web-scaling, and has extensive experience with engineering interviewing.

teamMember2.name: Li Lu
teamMember2.title: Instructor
teamMember2.detail: Li has three Computer Science Degrees including a B.S. from Tsinghua University and an M.S. and Ph.D. from the University of Rochester. He interned at Microsoft Research and Google and then joined the pre-IPO team at Hortonworks. Additionally, Li is an active Apache Hadoop contributor and committer.
